summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the Southern District of New York on October 27, 2020, authorizing the forensic review of three hard drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence on July 11, 2019. The warrant seeks evidence related to sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement, and conspiracy, specifically targeting communications, financial records, travel documents, and photographs involving Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and other co-conspirators and victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The private residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, from which the subject devices (hard drives) were seized on July 11, 2019, is identified as his. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence of his co-conspirators and communications related to the subject offenses.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Explicitly named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence concerning her identity, location, and communications.

connections.description: The warrant identifies Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Epstein in the subject offenses (sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement, and conspiracy).

events.title: Search of Epstein's New York Residence
events.description: Law enforcement executed a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, seizing three hard drives from a bookshelf cabinet in an oval study.

events.title: Warrant Issued for Forensic Review
events.description: A magistrate judge issued this search warrant authorizing the forensic review of the three hard drives seized from Epstein's residence, seeking evidence for violations of federal sex trafficking statutes.

events.title: Investigation Timeframe
events.description: The warrant authorizes a search for evidence related to the subject offenses for the period from 1994 through August 8, 2019 (the date of Epstein's death).

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Jeffrey Epstein's private residence, referred to as the 'New York Residence')
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the issuing court)
keyFacts: Three 'Seagate Path 100' hard drives were seized from a bookshelf in an oval study at Epstein's New York residence on July 11, 2019.
The warrant explicitly names Ghislaine Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein in the subject offenses.

The search seeks evidence of violations including sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591), transportation of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 2422), enticement to travel (18 U.S.C. ยง 2423), and conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371).

The warrant authorizes a search for specific categories of evidence including communications among co-conspirators, financial records of payments, travel documents for victims, and sexually suggestive photographs of teenage girls.
The document indicates the existence of other, unnamed co-conspirators and victims, as the warrant seeks evidence concerning their identity and location.
